an7.22:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
an7.22:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

an7.22:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo hoti.
an7.22:1.3.eng: Now at that time King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, wanted to invade the Vajjis.

an7.22:1.5.pli: “ahaṃ hime vajjī evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi, vajjī vināsessāmi, vajjī anayabyasanaṃ āpādessāmī”ti.
an7.22:1.5.eng: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”

an7.22:2.1.pli: Atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vassakāraṃ brāhmaṇaṃ māgadhamahāmattaṃ āmantesi:
an7.22:2.1.eng: And then King Ajātasattu addressed Vassakāra the brahmin minister of Magadha,

an7.22:2.2.pli: “ehi tvaṃ, brāhmaṇa, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi, appābādhaṃ appātaṅkaṃ lahuṭṭhānaṃ balaṃ phāsuvihāraṃ puccha:
an7.22:2.2.eng: “Please, brahmin, go to the Buddha, and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.

an7.22:2.3.pli: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṃ appātaṅkaṃ lahuṭṭhānaṃ balaṃ phāsuvihāraṃ pucchatī’ti.

an7.22:2.5.pli: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
an7.22:2.5.eng: ‘Sir, King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, wants to invade the Vajjis.

an7.22:2.7.pli: ahaṃ hime vajjī evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi, vajjī vināsessāmi, vajjī anayabyasanaṃ āpādessāmī’ti.
an7.22:2.7.eng: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”’

an7.22:2.8.pli: Yathā te bhagavā byākaroti, taṃ sādhukaṃ uggahetvā mama āroceyyāsi.
an7.22:2.8.eng: Remember well how the Buddha answers and tell it to me.

an7.22:2.9.eng: For Realized Ones say nothing that is not so.”

an7.22:3.1.pli: “Evaṃ, bho”ti kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo māgadhamahāmatto rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṃ sammodi.
an7.22:3.1.eng: “Yes, worthy sir,” Vassakāra replied. He went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

an7.22:3.2.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo māgadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an7.22:3.2.eng: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

an7.22:3.3.pli: “rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṃ appātaṅkaṃ lahuṭṭhānaṃ balaṃ phāsuvihāraṃ pucchati.
an7.22:3.3.eng: “Worthy Gotama, King Ajātasattu bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.

an7.22:3.4.pli: Rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
an7.22:3.4.eng: King Ajātasattu wants to invade the Vajjis.

an7.22:3.6.pli: ‘ahaṃ hime vajjī evaṃmahiddhike evaṃmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi, vajjī vināsessāmi, vajjī anayabyasanaṃ āpādessāmī’”ti.
an7.22:3.6.eng: ‘I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!’”

an7.22:4.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando bhagavato piṭṭhito ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṃ bījayamāno.
an7.22:4.1.eng: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Buddha fanning him.

an7.22:4.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ ānandaṃ āmantesi:
an7.22:4.2.eng: Then the Buddha said to him:

an7.22:4.3.pli: “kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā sannipātabahulā’”ti?
an7.22:4.3.eng: “Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings?”

an7.22:4.5.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:4.5.eng: “As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:5.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti?
an7.22:5.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony?”

an7.22:5.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti.

an7.22:5.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karissanti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:5.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:6.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī apaññattaṃ na paññāpenti, paññattaṃ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti?
an7.22:6.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the ancient Vajjian principles as they have been decreed?”

an7.22:6.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjī apaññattaṃ na paññāpenti, paññattaṃ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti.

an7.22:6.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī apaññattaṃ na paññāpessanti, paññattaṃ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattissanti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:6.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the ancient Vajjian traditions as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:7.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṃ vajjimahallakā te sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṃ maññantī’”ti?
an7.22:7.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to?”

an7.22:7.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṃ vajjimahallakā te sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṃ maññantī’”ti.

an7.22:7.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī ye te vajjīnaṃ vajjimahallakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṃ maññissanti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:7.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:8.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti?
an7.22:8.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t forcibly abduct the women or girls of the clans and make them live with them?”

an7.22:8.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti.

an7.22:8.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okassa pasayha vāsessanti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:8.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis don’t forcibly abduct the women or girls of the clans and make them live with them, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:9.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṃ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca tāni sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ dhammikaṃ baliṃ no parihāpentī’”ti?
an7.22:9.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past?”

an7.22:9.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṃ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca tāni sakkaronti garuṃ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ dhammikaṃ baliṃ no parihāpentī’”ti.

an7.22:9.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṃ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca tāni sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca dinnapubbaṃ katapubbaṃ dhammikaṃ baliṃ no parihāpessanti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.22:9.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:10.1.pli: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṃ: ‘vajjīnaṃ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṃvihitā—kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṃ āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsuṃ vihareyyun’”ti?
an7.22:10.1.eng: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort?”

an7.22:10.2.pli: “Sutaṃ metaṃ, bhante: ‘vajjīnaṃ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṃvihitā bhavissati—kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṃ āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsuṃ vihareyyun’”ti.

an7.22:10.3.pli: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṃvihitā bhavissati: ‘kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṃ āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsuṃ vihareyyun’ti; vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.22:10.3.eng: “As long as the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.22:11.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā vassakāraṃ brāhmaṇaṃ māgadhamahāmattaṃ āmantesi:
an7.22:11.1.eng: Then the Buddha said to Vassakāra:

an7.22:11.2.pli: “ekamidāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, samayaṃ vesāliyaṃ viharāmi sārandade cetiye.
an7.22:11.2.eng: “Brahmin, this one time I was staying near Vesālī at the Sārandada Shrine.

an7.22:11.3.pli: Tatrāhaṃ, brāhmaṇa, vajjīnaṃ ime satta aparihāniye dhamme desesiṃ.
an7.22:11.3.eng: There I taught the Vajjis these principles that prevent decline.

an7.22:11.4.pli: Yāvakīvañca, brāhmaṇa, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā vajjīsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu vajjī sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, brāhmaṇa, vajjīnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.22:11.4.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the Vajjis, and as long as the Vajjis are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.22:12.1.pli: “Ekamekenapi, bho gotama, aparihāniyena dhammena samannāgatānaṃ vajjīnaṃ vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni;
an7.22:12.1.eng: When the Buddha had spoken, Vassakāra said to him: “Worthy Gotama, if the Vajjis follow even a single one of these principles they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.22:12.2.pli: ko pana vādo sattahi aparihāniyehi dhammehi.
an7.22:12.2.eng: How much more so all seven!

an7.22:12.3.pli: Akaraṇīyā ca, bho gotama, vajjī raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena yadidaṃ yuddhassa, aññatra upalāpanāya, aññatra mithubhedā.
an7.22:12.3.eng: King Ajātasattu cannot defeat the Vajjis in war, unless by bribery or by sowing dissension.

an7.22:12.4.pli: Handa ca dāni mayaṃ, bho gotama, gacchāma, bahukiccā mayaṃ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
an7.22:12.4.eng: Well, now, worthy Gotama, I must go. I have many duties, and much to do.”

an7.22:12.6.pli: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo māgadhamahāmatto bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmīti.
an7.22:12.6.eng: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.

an7.23:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
an7.23:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

an7.23:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

an7.23:1.4.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you these seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.23:1.5.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
an7.23:1.5.eng: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”

an7.23:1.6.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.

an7.23:2.1.eng: “What are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.23:2.2.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū abhiṇhaṃ sannipātā bhavissanti sannipātabahulā; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:2.2.eng: As long as the mendicants meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:3.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā saṅghakaraṇīyāni karissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:3.1.eng: As long as the mendicants meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:4.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apaññattaṃ na paññāpessanti, paññattaṃ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:4.1.eng: As long as the mendicants don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the training rules as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:5.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā te sakkarissanti garuṃ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṃ maññissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:5.1.eng: As long as the mendicants honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the senior mendicants—of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha—and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:6.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobhavikāya na vasaṃ gacchissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:6.1.eng: As long as the mendicants don’t fall under the sway of arisen craving for future lives, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:7.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āraññakesu senāsanesu sāpekkhā bhavissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:7.1.eng: As long as the mendicants take care to live in wilderness lodgings, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:8.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaññeva satiṃ upaṭṭhāpessanti: ‘kinti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun’ti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.23:8.1.eng: As long as the mendicants individually establish mindfulness, so that more good-hearted spiritual companions might come, and those that have already come may live comfortably, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.23:9.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.23:9.1.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.24:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.24:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well …

an7.24:1.3.pli: katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
an7.24:1.3.eng: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.24:2.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na kammārāmā bhavissanti, na kammaratā, na kammārāmataṃ anuyuttā; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.24:2.1.eng: As long as the mendicants don’t relish work, loving it and liking to relish it, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.24:3.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na bhassārāmā bhavissanti …pe…
an7.24:3.1.eng: As long as they don’t enjoy talk …

an7.24:3.4.pli: na pāpicchā bhavissanti na pāpikānaṃ icchānaṃ vasaṃ gatā …
an7.24:3.4.eng: they don’t have corrupt wishes, falling under the sway of corrupt wishes …

an7.24:3.5.pli: na pāpamittā bhavissanti na pāpasahāyā na pāpasampavaṅkā …
an7.24:3.5.eng: they don’t have bad friends, companions, and associates …

an7.24:3.6.pli: na oramattakena visesādhigamena antarāvosānaṃ āpajjissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.24:3.6.eng: they don’t stop half-way after achieving some trifling distinction, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.24:4.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.24:4.1.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.25:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.25:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well …

an7.25:1.3.pli: katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
an7.25:1.3.eng: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.25:1.4.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū saddhā bhavissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.25:1.4.eng: As long as the mendicants are faithful …

an7.25:2.6.pli: paññavanto bhavissanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.25:2.6.eng: wise, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.25:3.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.25:3.1.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.26:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.26:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well …

an7.26:1.3.pli: katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
an7.26:1.3.eng: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.26:1.4.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvessanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.26:1.4.eng: As long as the mendicants develop the awakening factor of mindfulness …

an7.26:2.6.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvessanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.26:2.6.eng: equanimity, they can expect growth, not decline.

an7.26:3.1.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.26:3.1.eng: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

an7.27:1.2.eng: Listen and apply your mind well …

an7.27:1.3.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
an7.27:1.3.eng: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

an7.27:1.4.pli: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aniccasaññaṃ bhāvessanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
an7.27:1.4.eng: As long as the mendicants develop the perception of impermanence …

an7.27:3.1.pli: vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu, bhikkhū sandississanti; vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
an7.27:3.1.eng: they can expect growth, not decline. As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

an7.28:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
an7.28:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.

an7.28:1.3.eng: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

an7.28:1.4.pli: “sattime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an7.28:1.4.eng: “These seven things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

an7.28:1.6.pli: Kammārāmatā, bhassārāmatā, niddārāmatā, saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu aguttadvāratā, bhojane amattaññutā, santi kho pana saṅghe saṅghakaraṇīyāni; tatra sekho bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
an7.28:1.6.eng: They relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They don’t guard the sense doors and they eat too much. And when there is Saṅgha business to be carried out, they don’t reflect:

an7.28:1.7.pli: ‘santi kho pana saṅghe therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā bhāravāhino, te tena paññāyissantī’ti attanā tesu yogaṃ āpajjati.
an7.28:1.7.eng: ‘There are senior mendicants in the Saṅgha of long standing, long gone forth, responsible. They’ll be known for taking care of this.’ So they get involved in that.

an7.28:1.8.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an7.28:1.8.eng: These seven things lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

an7.28:2.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
an7.28:2.1.eng: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.

an7.28:2.3.pli: Na kammārāmatā, na bhassārāmatā, na niddārāmatā, na saṅgaṇikārāmatā, indriyesu guttadvāratā, bhojane mattaññutā, santi kho pana saṅghe saṅghakaraṇīyāni; tatra sekho bhikkhu iti paṭisañcikkhati:
an7.28:2.3.eng: They don’t relish work, talk, sleep, and company. They guard the sense doors and don’t eat too much. And when there is Saṅgha business to be carried out, they reflect:

an7.28:2.4.pli: ‘santi kho pana saṅghe therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā bhāravāhino, te tena paññāyissantī’ti attanā na tesu yogaṃ āpajjati.
an7.28:2.4.eng: ‘There are senior mendicants in the Saṅgha of long standing, long gone forth, responsible. They’ll be known for taking care of this.’ So they don’t get involved in that.

an7.28:2.5.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā sekhassa bhikkhuno aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an7.28:2.5.eng: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant trainee.”

an7.29:1.1.eng: “These seven things lead to the decline of a lay follower.

an7.29:1.3.eng: They miss out on seeing the mendicants.

an7.29:1.4.eng: They neglect listening to the true teaching.

an7.29:1.5.eng: They don’t train in higher ethical conduct.

an7.29:1.6.eng: They’re very suspicious about mendicants, whether senior, junior, or middle.

an7.29:1.7.pli: bhikkhūsu theresu ceva navesu ca majjhimesu ca upārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti randhagavesī,
an7.29:1.7.eng: They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.

an7.29:1.8.eng: They seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.

an7.29:1.10.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā upāsakassa parihānāya saṃvattanti.
an7.29:1.10.eng: These seven things lead to the decline of a lay follower.

an7.29:2.1.pli: Sattime, bhikkhave, dhammā upāsakassa aparihānāya saṃvattanti.
an7.29:2.1.eng: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a lay follower.

an7.29:2.3.eng: They don’t miss out on seeing the mendicants.

an7.29:2.4.eng: They don’t neglect listening to the true teaching.

an7.29:2.5.eng: They train in higher ethical conduct.

an7.29:2.6.eng: They’re very confident about mendicants, whether senior, junior, or middle.

an7.29:2.7.pli: bhikkhūsu theresu ceva navesu ca majjhimesu ca anupārambhacitto dhammaṃ suṇāti na randhagavesī,
an7.29:2.7.eng: They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.

an7.29:2.8.eng: They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.

an7.29:2.9.eng: And they serve the Buddhist community first.

an7.29:2.10.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, satta dhammā upāsakassa aparihānāya saṃvattantī”ti.
an7.29:2.10.eng: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a lay follower.”

an7.29:2.11.eng: That is what the Buddha said.

an7.29:2.12.pli: Idaṃ vatvāna sugato athāparaṃ etadavoca satthā:
an7.29:2.12.eng: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

an7.29:3.1.eng: “A lay follower misses out on seeing

an7.29:3.3.eng: and listening to the teachings of the Noble One.

an7.29:3.4.eng: They don’t train in higher ethical conduct,

an7.29:4.3.eng: They want to listen to the true teaching

an7.29:5.1.eng: They seek outside the Buddhist community

an7.29:5.2.eng: for someone else worthy of religious donations,

an7.29:6.1.eng: These seven principles leading to decline

an7.29:6.3.eng: A lay follower who practices them

an7.29:6.4.eng: falls away from the true teaching.

an7.29:7.1.eng: A lay follower doesn’t miss out on seeing

an7.29:7.3.eng: and listening to the teachings of the Noble One.

an7.29:7.4.eng: They train in higher ethical conduct,

an7.29:8.3.eng: They want to listen to the true teaching

an7.29:9.1.eng: They don’t seek outside the Buddhist community

an7.29:9.2.eng: for someone else worthy of religious donations,

an7.29:10.1.eng: These seven principles that prevent decline

an7.29:10.3.eng: A lay follower who practices them

an7.29:10.4.eng: doesn’t fall away from the true teaching.”

an7.3:1.2.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme …pe…
an7.3:1.2.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery. …

an7.3:1.5.pli: Saddhābalaṃ, vīriyabalaṃ, hirībalaṃ, ottappabalaṃ, satibalaṃ, samādhibalaṃ, paññābalaṃ.
an7.3:1.5.eng: The powers of faith, energy, conscience, prudence, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.

an7.3:2.1.eng: The powers are faith and energy,

an7.3:2.4.eng: and wisdom as the seventh power.

an7.3:3.1.eng: They should examine the teaching rationally,

an7.3:3.4.eng: is like a lamp going out.”

an7.30:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these seven failures for a lay follower …

an7.30:1.2.eng: There are these seven accomplishments for a lay follower …”
